content:
Here are some healthy breakfast options that are high in protein to help with muscle recovery after your morning workout:

**Egg-cellent Options:**

1. **Scrambled Eggs with Spinach and Feta**: 2 whole eggs, 1/2 cup spinach, 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese (22g protein)
2. **Egg Omelette with Mushrooms and Turkey Bacon**: 2 whole eggs, 1/2 cup mushrooms, 2 slices turkey bacon (25g protein)
3. **Hard-Boiled Eggs with Avocado Toast**: 2 hard-boiled eggs, 1 slice whole grain bread, 1/2 avocado (20g protein)

**Dairy Delights:**

1. **Greek Yogurt with Berries and Nuts**: 1 cup Greek yogurt, 1/2 cup mixed berries, 1 tablespoon almonds (20g protein)
2. **Cottage Cheese with Peaches and Cinnamon**: 1/2 cup cottage cheese, 1/2 cup sliced peaches, 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon (28g protein)
3. **Protein Smoothie with Banana and Milk**: 1 scoop whey protein powder, 1 cup milk, 1 banana (30g protein)

**Meat and Veggie Combos:**

1. **Turkey and Avocado Wrap**: 1 whole wheat tortilla, 2 slices turkey breast, 1/2 avocado, 1 cup mixed greens (30g protein)
2. **Grilled Chicken Breast with Sweet Potato and Broccoli**: 3 oz grilled chicken breast, 1 medium sweet potato, 1 cup broccoli (35g protein)
3. **Smoked Salmon with Scrambled Eggs and Spinach**: 2 slices smoked salmon, 2 whole eggs, 1/2 cup spinach (30g protein)

**Plant-Based Powerhouses:**

1. **Tofu Scramble with Spinach and Whole Wheat Toast**: 1/2 cup scrambled tofu, 1/2 cup spinach, 1 slice whole wheat bread (20g protein)
2. **Chia Seed Pudding with Banana and Almond Milk**: 1/2 cup chia seeds, 1 cup almond milk, 1 banana (15g protein)
3. **Quinoa Breakfast Bowl with Almond Milk and Berries**: 1 cup cooked quinoa, 1 cup almond milk, 1/2 cup mixed berries (15g protein)

Remember to stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water or a sports drink to help with muscle recovery. Additionally, aim to consume your post-workout meal or snack within 30-60 minutes after your workout to help promote muscle recovery and growth.

Happy fueling!
